p: In a previous study, we found that J. gaumeri latex demonstrated analgesic and anti-inflammatory activity in patients with buccal ulcers [ 20]. We have now also demonstrated the wound healing effects of J. gaumeri latex in a murine model. To date, the phytochemical composition of J. gaumeri latex and its medicinal activities have not been extensively studied; however, several published papers have demonstrated the antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, wound healing, angiogenic, coagulant, and anticoagulant effects of other Jatropha species [ 6- 8, 10, 11, 16, 17, 23]. There is no doubt that the lattices of Jatropha species have broad spectra of activity that deserves further research to elucidate the active phytochemicals involved.
